isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS CELECT 1992 - 1993 - DIAGNOSTICS - PERFORMING A DIAGNOSTIC CHECK

svcprocinfo.para: A diagnostic check may be performed using the Diagnostic ON/OFF switch and Idle/Diagnostic INC/DEC switch. Any error codes will be flashed through the red and yellow warning lights. If no errors are found, both lights will stay on while the diagnostics switch is on. Consult the Cummins Operation and Maintenance Manual furnished with the vehicle for exact procedures and fault code information.
To determine the fault codes use the following procedure:

item.para: Begin the procedure with the engine off.
Place the switch key in the OFF position.
Turn the diagnostic ON/OFF switch to the ON position.
Turn the key switch to RUN position (not crank).

note.para: Cummins CELECT engine diagnostics must be run with the engine NOT RUNNING. If BOTH the Yellow Engine Warning and Red Engine Stop come on momentarily and then go out, it is an indication that engine faults are present. If BOTH Yellow Engine Warning and Red Engine Stop lights come on and stay on, it is an indication that no engine faults are present.

item.para: Yellow Engine Warning light will flash once.
There will be a one to two second pause.
Red Engine Stop will flash code with one or two seconds between digits.

note.para: All Cummins fault codes are 3 digits.

item.para: Yellow Engine Warning light will flash indicating the end of that fault code, and then start over and repeat the same fault code.
To go to the second fault code, move the IDLE/DIAGNOSTIC INC/DEC switch to the INC position and then release it. The process will then repeat itself as indicated in steps 5 through 8.

To move back to the last or previous fault code, move the IDLE/DIAGNOSTIC INC/DEC switch to the DEC position and then release it. The process will then repeat itself as indicated in steps 5 through 8.
To stop the diagnostics procedure, correct the faults or move the diagnostic ON/OFF switch to the OFF, and turn the vehicle key switch to the OFF position.

svcprocinfo.para: For example, the "yellow warning" light flashes once. The "red" engine stop light flashes: FLASH. Digit number one is 1. Then there is a pause. FLASH - FLASH. Digit number two is 2. Then there is pause. FLASH - FLASH - FLASH. Digit number three is 3. Yellow engine warning lamp flashes once. The fault code is 123.

svcsubproc.title: Compulink™
svcsubproc.para: CELECT vehicles have a data link for the Compulink. The Compulink is used to program owner-specified information into the engine, monitor the system, and aid in troubleshooting the engine. Consult the Cummins CELECT Troubleshooting and Repair Manual. The CompulinkTM may be available at the nearest Cummins Authorized Service Center.
CompulinkTM must be used with a CELECT service cartridge to communicate with a CELECT engine. A PACE or PT PACER cartridge will not work properly.

note.para: On the Cummins Compulink, since no alpha characters are available, use the up arrow and down arrow to move through the alphabet.

svcsubproc.title: Pro-Link 9000 Diagnostic Data Reader (DDR)
svcsubproc.para: The PRO-LINK 9000 DDR with the Heavy Duty Standard cartridge can also be used with the International Data Link to read active and inactive fault codes through the data link. The use of the DDR or specific codes are not discussed in this manual as the information is part of the Pro-Link documentation.

The Pro-Link can also be used to monitor operation of various switches and controls and perform other diagnostic tasks. The specific capabilities and operating instructions are included in the Pro-Link documentation for the DDR and the cartridge.
